subject: Re: [junit] does junit.textui.TestRunner.run return a non zero status code? ( junit & ant problem)
msgSnippet: ... The TestRunner classes are there, look down in junit.swingui.TestRunner, junit.textui.TestRunner, etc. -- Joi Ellis                    Software Engineer
messageBody:
On Fri, 2 Feb 2001, Perry Tew wrote:

> Joi,
> Thanks for the tip. Unfortunately, I'm running this on an NT
> platform. I should have mentioned my platform. Sorry.
>
> Let me ask this. Where can I get the apis and source for the
> TestRunners? I don't see it in the downloads. Is it in the CVS? I
> haven't used CVS before, but I will if I need to. Can anyone point
> me to where I might get this? (Did I miss something in the
> download?) I'm using JUnit 3.5.

The TestRunner classes are there, look down in junit.swingui.TestRunner,
junit.textui.TestRunner, etc.

--
Joi Ellis Software Engineer
Aravox Technologies joi@..., gyles19@...

No matter what we think of Linux versus FreeBSD, etc., the one thing I
really like about Linux is that it has Microsoft worried. Anything
that kicks a monopoly in the pants has got to be good for something.
- Chris Johnson
